entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 28 at 11:15PM AKDT until October 30 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SATURDAY TO 1 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Haines Highway. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 1 AM AKDT Sunday.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:12PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor will generally continue on a slow decline, remaining within Moderate Flood Stage. Levels at Astor will continue a very slow recession through the weekend, although northerly winds may temporarily prevent a further decline in levels

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:09PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Deland remains just below Major Flood stage and will continue to slowly fall through Moderate Flood stage through next week. Interests along the river will continue to experience moderate flood impacts, though conditions will slowly

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:05PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through next week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:03PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The St. Johns River above Lake Harney at Geneva has fallen below Major Flood Stage and is forecast to continue a slow decline through Moderate Flood Stage into next week. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog Early this Morning... Areas of fog have developed early this morning across portions of northern Illinois, some of which has become locally dense. Reduced visibility in fog may persist through 8 or 9 A.M. this morning before improving. Allow extra travel time this morning, use low beams, and be prepared for rapidly fluctuating visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 3:06AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG NEAR LAKE MICHIGAN THIS MORNING... Patchy dense fog will reduce visibilities to one-quarter mile or less in the lakeshore counties this morning. The fog should persist until 8 am or 9 am before mixing out. Motorists should be alert for poor or rapidly changing visibilities early this morning. When driving in fog, reduce your speed, keep a
